timeline.bodyText: my  comment below  is not required, but it would be nice to tell the user why this needs to be done. i.e. parallel gateway sender queues are  collocated with the parent region
timeline.author: nabarunnag

@@ -170,7 +170,10 @@ Example of using a named disk store for PDX serialization metadata (cache.xml):
 
 Gateway sender queues are always overflowed and may be persisted. Assign them to overflow disk stores if you do not persist, and to persistence disk stores if you do.
 
-Example of using a named disk store for gateway sender queue persistence:
+Persisted data from a parallel gateway sender must go to the same disk
+store as used by the region.
